item.title: Greetings for Chinese New Year in the office and business with a traditional lohei celebration
item.description: This scroll says 生意興隆/生意兴隆 (sheng yi xing long), which translates to “may the business thrive greatly.” The celebratory atmosphere in mainland China, Taiwan, Hong Kong, and Singapore is palpable this time of year. Everywhere you look, lucky red and gold decorations are for sale, along with symbols of the upcoming year’s zodiac animal. Chinese New Year falls on February 8th in 2016, and well-wishes in the form of traditional greetings will be exchanged from the very first day.
